gw.api.database

Class GroupingQuery<T extends Bean>

  • java.lang.Object
    • gw.api.database.GroupingQuery<T>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IQuery<T>

    public class GroupingQuery<T extends Bean>
extends Object
implements IQuery<T>
    Represents the results of an intersect or union operation.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      IEntityType EntityType
      the query type for the query.
      boolean LogSQL
      true if the sql for this query will be logged, false if not. The query is logged to the PLLoggerCategory.SERVER_DATABASE log category at the info level
      com.guidewire.pl.system.database.impl.QueryImpl<Bean> RawQuery

      • Fields inherited from class java.lang.Object

        Class

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean hasRestrictions()
      {@inheritDoc}
      GroupingQuery<Bean> intersect(IQuery<Bean> intersectQuery)
      Intersects this query with the query passed in. The return type of the two queries must be equal.
      IQueryBeanResult<Bean> select()
      Returns a new query processor used to read the results. The query processor can also be used to set sort columns.
      void setRootName(String rootName)
      {@inheritDoc}
      String toString()
      GroupingQuery<Bean> union(IQuery<Bean> unionQuery)
      Unions this query with the query passed in. The return type of the two queries must be equal. The result query will not contain duplicate queries from the two sets. Union can only be done once on a query. Basically this method builds a binary tree and the result of this method is the union of this query and unionQuery.
      GroupingQuery<Bean> withLogSQL(boolean logSQL)
      Turns on or off SQL logging. The query is logged to the PLLoggerCategory.SERVER_DATABASE log category at the info level

      • Methods inherited from class gw.api.database.IQuery

        hasRestrictions, intersect, select, setRootName, toString, union

        GroupingQuery<Bean> intersect(IQuery<Bean> intersectQuery)

      • select

        IQueryBeanResult<Bean> select()
        Returns a new query processor used to read the results. The query processor can also be used to set sort columns.
        Returns:
        a new query processor. The query is not executed until the first result is read.

      • setRootName

        void setRootName(String rootName)
        {@inheritDoc}
        Parameters:
        rootName -

      • union

        GroupingQuery<Bean> union(IQuery<Bean> unionQuery)
        Unions this query with the query passed in. The return type of the two queries must be equal. The result query will not contain duplicate queries from the two sets. Union can only be done once on a query. Basically this method builds a binary tree and the result of this method is the union of this query and unionQuery.
        Parameters:
        unionQuery - the query to union with
        Returns:
        the result query that is the union of this and the query passed in.

      • withLogSQL

        GroupingQuery<Bean> withLogSQL(boolean logSQL)
        Turns on or off SQL logging. The query is logged to the PLLoggerCategory.SERVER_DATABASE log category at the info level
        Parameters:
        logSQL - true to log SQL, false to not
        Returns:
